Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2008 03:11PM carollyn wrote: DX days for B-9 results should be called " Re-Birthdays".  Another day that should be celebrated in the heart and soul!  Happy Re-Birthday to you!!!!!!! Carol
Posts.Title: Results due today!! sbd sbd

Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2008 06:51PM carollyn wrote: Two years ago I had a birads 4.  Only because of family history did I elect for a lumpectomy (wanted a mast, but husband and surgeon talked me out of it).  Mine was B9, but ADH.  So I went on my merry way, never turning back.  My mistake.  I now have a bilat mast scheduled on 5 June, B6, axcillary nodes noted.  Will be having recon same day, chemo, and unknown on rad until surgery w/stage.  My only mistake was thinking B9 once, B9 always.  Silly girl me!  Always, always keep in touch and a close eye on your girls. :)
Posts.Title: BIRAD kathy46 Donna1843

Posts.Content: Jun 2, 2008 07:51PM carollyn wrote: Well 2.5 days and counting!!  Last night, had a wonderful ' going away ' party for my breasts.  The girls that own the business next to mine planned it and it was a wonderful evening.  Girls only, friends, employees, sister, daughter and neighbors came.  Gag gifts, funny cards and no depressing emotional stuff.  It was great!!!  Wish you all could have been there.  Wednesday I go to Miami and get my dye injection for the nodes, then it's 7am Thursday morning.  Does anyone think I'll be home by Friday evening?  I talked to one woman who had her bi-lat in outpatient surgery same day. ???? Just curious?

Posts.Content: May 15, 2008 08:06PM carollyn wrote: Dear Girls, I will start a June list tomarrow, with everyones stat's,  had a hard day of yesterday, with onco doc, surgery doc, plastic doc, ekg, labs, anth doc, sniffle/sneeze doc, x-ray, blood donation/transfer, daughter blood donation, too many papers to sign...needless to say, I had a long day yesterday.  Wow I'm wiped out today after working all day.  Any ways I will get the list started for us June Girl's.  We can go from there..  Happy May to those in surgery, and recovery......be there gor us Juner's!!!!!  Carol
Posts.Title: Surgery in June? carollyn Kymberlyn

Posts.Content: May 22, 2008 06:28PM carollyn wrote: For the girls that don't read alot on this board, your should.  Where did you think I learned everything from using a shoelace tied around your neck to hang your drain tubes during showers?  Here!  Where do you think I learned about buying the U-shaped pillow for breast feeding moms to use right after surgery so my arms are raised and might lessen the chance of lymph-oma arms?  Here!  Where do you think I learned about BRAC1/BRAC2 genectic links and tests?  Here!  Where do you think I learned so much about so many womans same situations, different emotions, and different outcomes from so I could choose which outcome would be mine?  RIGHT HERE!!!!  It is home, for when I need to get away from home.  This board keeps me strong, keeps me thinking positively straight.  Exactly were we all need to be.  Breast Cancer now adays is as they say " very do'able"...but emotionally draining to all involved.  Coming here might not answer all, but soften's the pitter-patter of our anxious hearts.
Posts.Title: Surgery in June? carollyn Kymberlyn

Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2008 08:43AM carollyn wrote: Welcome home Carol (CAZ)!!!  Hope you are adjusting well today.  I split my days up into 1/4's to think about my recovery (like AA=one day at a time), and each quarter I was able to pat myself on the back and say "That's a girl"!

Posts.Content: May 5, 2008 07:49PM carollyn wrote: Thanks for the info....I'm not gray (yet), but because I'm in retail, not alot of people accept 'illness'.  So I thought it would be better of me to look as normal for work as possible because I am the manager.  If I really wanted to show the real me after hair loss I would wear one of those halloween clown fuzzy wigs that are red, blue, green and yellow.  But that's the real me! :) In today's market, sales = profit, profit = bonuses, bonuses = my income.  Don't want to scare people away.

Posts.Content: May 27, 2008 06:17PM carollyn wrote: Well I'm 1+1/2 weeks out from surgery girls.....as some of you know my husband and I bought a house and gutted it in Jan and I knew I had a lump then.  Had a lump at old lumpectomy site and 2 new ones.  Said when we got done with the ceilings/walls and then solid wood floors insatlled I  would go have it looked at.  Anyways, that was yesterday and here I am today.  My husband and I are still working on ten million projects to get the house done, so sorry breast cancer has interupted our lives!  Deal with it!  I haven't had one moment for a melt down because I am too busy getting on with life.  So I say to those to blue to move on, lift your left leg behind you...give a kick, and move on for yourself and all of us, and keep coming back for all the newbies that  need us for the lift.  Comfort to everyone tonight.  Tomorrow is a great day!!!!!!!!!    Carol
Posts.Title: Surgery in June? carollyn Kymberlyn

Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2008 03:53PM carollyn wrote: Just got back from Miami, had the radioactive injections into the breast and nodes for tomorrow morning.....man alive....by the 5th needle i was begging for no more.  Am home in my jammies now and icing the breast.  Well ladies I will give you all a shout when I get home.  Mason 204 how are you doing today?  Tomorrows your day as well!!!!  Anneisse was yesterday.  See you all in a few days or so.
Posts.Title: Surgery in June? carollyn Kymberlyn

Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2008 09:33AM carollyn wrote: Actually I was on the stool softeners, choc ex-lax squares and prune juice.  Needless to say, you all can't say I'm full of shit anymore!!!!  No path results yet.  See my BS and PS tomorrow for first follow-up appointment.  Enjoying all this quiet time at home.  Mason and Looney, glad to hear all is well!
Posts.Title: Surgery in June? carollyn Kymberlyn

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2008 08:34AM carollyn wrote: Nann,,,like everyone else states, everyone is extremely different with every aspect of BC's grip and outcome.  Remember though to use your mind methodically to ' help ' determine your outcome.  I had surgery exactly 1 week ago this day and hour.  I had bi-lat mast with recon expanders.  Yes expanders 'add' to the discomfort, but my pain level was extremely low from the surgery.  If I hadn't had the expanders put in at surgery time with a first fill, I'm sure I would have been back to work within 2-3 days.  My motion is good.  Yes I do have limits with my node arm, but I work on it daily.  I found that a body pillow worked great for when I was in reclining chair just reading, as I draped in over my lap & arms of the chair.  This caused me to cronically keep my arms in an elavated position while resting.  Only spent 2 nites in recliner, now I'm just elavated in bed next to DH.  I am going back to work on monday the 16th.  My PS does not approve, but he is not the manager and doesn't have 1 1/2 weeks of business to catch up on.  He told me if I lift one thing or do one thing wrong, he would drop me as a patient.  Anyways, that's my story how everyone is different.  For me, 1 and 1/2 weeks of down time.  Wahine, glad you liked my interpretation of my body to surgeon.  It's my way of having the last laugh at BC.  Glad I can find humor amoungst the debris.  Carol

Posts.Content: May 7, 2008 06:09PM carollyn wrote: Love Hat's! Thanks.  I think most professional woman want to remain as normal as possible, but I believe I might have a 'hat' day or two in store for me.  It's kind of related to " Anal Glocoma"...that's were you "can't SEE your BUTT" going to work that day!  Am sure I might have some of them coming up.  Don't know how many of the sisters on this board are in professional fields, and I know most of us discuss mostly the emotional issues related, but what is the best way to conduct oneself professionally, i.e., remarks, head gear, avoidance????  This could be a thread to re-address some of these issues for all newbies.  Thanks ladies!!!! Carol

Posts.Title: Surgery in June? carollyn Kymberlyn

Posts.Content: May 13, 2008 11:01PM carollyn wrote: Dear rosy...remember we are all here, we are strong, we will get through this.  We are a battle that will survive us.  Remember that when he/she sais the "C" word to you, that you become strong.  You are one and will carry on.  Keep that in mind and that is all you need to know.  You are the strength of all you need, and if and dought of that, there are ten million sister's on this site that will tell you different.  We are here for a reason, because we have been diagnosed.  We don't want to be here, but we are.  Think about it.  We will be here for you, like you will be here for us.  Carol
Posts.Title: Surgery in June? carollyn Kymberlyn

Posts.Content: May 21, 2008 03:58PM carollyn wrote: Mason204, you and I are set for the same day!  Having one of those ' back-track' moments.  You know, like when you finally started hard labor during delivary and in your head you just wanted to turn back time and not be pregnant and in labor (but really wanted the growth inside to be out).  Well I've been fine over the weeks, mentally, with the whole "let's get this thing out and over with"!  Today I just wish I could change everything and put it back the way it was.  For the first time I am feeling a little apprehensive.  I don't know why.  Carol
Posts.Title: Surgery in June? carollyn Kymberlyn

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2008 03:57PM carollyn wrote: Well HELLO Girls !!!!!!!!!!  I'm back!!!!!!  Feeling on top of the world right now.  No it's not the pain meds talking either.  Got home yesterday from the hospital and am doing great.  Didn't sleep that much first night after surgery, had an 'itchey' finger near that 'insta-moriphine' majic button.  Said no more, and asked for pills instead.  Then they forgot about me Friday night, no antibiotic I.V. and not pain meds that night.  So I got out of there early yesterday morning.  Husband and daughter did much better job taking care of me.  Washed my hair this a.m. and went for a walk down the road.  No complications, except for the dreaded...doom-doom-da-doom...."CONSTIPATION"!!!!!!  At least now if people want to tell me I'm full of shit, I will believe them, this week at least.  Glad to be home.  Guess what, I came home with A's already.  The PS put in 60cc's.  Ouch is all I have to say.  Carol
Posts.Title: Surgery in June? carollyn Kymberlyn

Posts.Content: Jun 9, 2008 11:24AM carollyn wrote: Going to go call the surgeon to see if the path reports are in yet.  Keep your fingers crossed for me :)   Carol
Posts.Title: Surgery in June? carollyn Kymberlyn

Posts.Content: Jun 11, 2008 05:27PM carollyn wrote: Well had to share my post op appt.'s with you all.  Had the chief of surgery pee'in in his pants this morning.  I told him that when I got home, I went to the full length mirror to look at myself, and all I could think of was a 'china-man' (as i squinted my eyes at him) and wanted to draw a huge smiley face on my body!!!!  Boy did he and every laugh.  PS decided to leave my drains in for one more week, no fills today, but next week yes.  Have my first onco appt next thursday.  Great news today was my nodes were clear!  Yeah!  Any who's, me and hubby went to lunch at our favorite knoshing place to celebrate NO NODES!!!!!  Later ladies....Carol
Posts.Title: Surgery in June? carollyn Kymberlyn

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2008 06:43PM carollyn wrote: JanB....My husband and I just talked about this tonight.  He is glad that I have done so much research, talking, and thinking in regards to the final outcome.  I asked him, do you want my health to bring you to this state again?  The answer was no!  Do you want my health to bring our daughter running home from college (her new life) again?  He said no.  I asked him would you rather see me and know me like this, right now...in your face 'Cancer', right now, get it out of the way, the pain, the feelings, the everything....so that both he and I can get on with our lifes as we know it, and leave this little intruder on the side of the road when we first met him!  So my husband saw where we were going to be, and joined me fully for the ride to say goodbye to 'my' hitchhiker!!!!  JanB, hug your husband tonite and talk very open about the future, not the here and now.  Carol.....
Posts.Title: Surgery in June? carollyn Kymberlyn

Posts.Content: Jun 17, 2008 04:37PM carollyn wrote: Lauren, I had bilat w/recon on 05 Jun, went back to work yesterday 17 Jun because I got tired of soap opera's, the View, and Judge Judy.  It's totally up to each individual....I too tried to get a plan going with work return, but couldn't grasp any real answer.  Because there is none.  Trust me when I say, "You will know".  Tell them at work perhaps 2-3 weeks if that's what you feel you may fall into.  If you know you don't deal with "issues" lighty, then tell them to plan 'for perhaps' a month......if you are a ninja (like me) tell them all "see ya'll next week"!  Then ask them for 2 extra day's to keep them guessing and hero worshipping you! LOL....Most of all be strong for you not work.  It will always be there!  I just got tired of T.V.   Carol(FL)

Posts.Content: May 13, 2008 08:57PM carollyn wrote: I agree with wishiwere, go to a breast cancer only institute.  I live maybe 30 miles from my BS, so I felt something, waited a couple of months while I was busy with  my personal/work life, called a 'local' breast screen place....my report came back clean health, nothing at all on the Ultra sounds readings....can only say, go to a MAJOR breast clinic only.  IDC.......ADH last time!

Posts.Content: carollyn wrote: I have a few 'bizarre' questions for any peri/meno, or post menopaus woman who had bi-lat mast's.  i need to know is it me, or is it alien's? 1.  Did anyone experience feeling's of anxiety like when they were in puberity?  Like didn't know what sex was, but had a weird 'feeling' all-over? 2.  Has anyone experienced a ' hey, how are you doing' welcome from either ovary, even though you haven't known them to exist in your body in the past 1 1/2 years?  Like a " fooled ya!  Think I might give you a menstral after all this time" feeling? I am only out 12 days from bimast/recon, but these overt feminine feelings have me guessing as to what comes next.  Has anyone else experienced these?  Thanks....Carol (FL) Dx 4/16/2008, IDC, 1cm, Stage IB, Grade 2, 0/16 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Odd Questions, need help carollyn carollyn

Posts.Content: Jun 17, 2008 09:52PM carollyn wrote: Perhaps you misunderstood, I'm post menopause, and haven't had these feelings for some time.  So why now, after a bi-lat?
Posts.Title: Odd Questions, need help carollyn carollyn

Posts.Content: carollyn wrote: Year and a half ago had tumor removed for possible alh.  It was right on my chest wall on/near the sternum.  Well I went back recently because I have had a rather large palpable lump near my underarm at 10 position.  The local doctor us's it and said I needed to get back to my surgeon to check.  Well I made an appointment for Monday (yesterday) and was supposed to have it mammo's and us'd by them (Jaskson Memorial cancer inst, Miami).  The tech did the spot mammo's on me and the radioligist doctor did the US.  She kept referring to my 10 position tumor as the malignant one, and my 3 position one as unknown as that was my previous surgery sight yet there is something definitley there, saw shadowing with a thickness.  I'm thinking they didn't get everything.  My breast doc agree's with everything from the radioligist and am having a MRI and vacumn assist biopsy of both.  They wan't the MRI to look at my left breast as well.  Anybody ever had the MRI/vacumn before?  And what is your take on the breast radiologist already referring to "the malignant one"?  Thanks for your help. Dx 4/16/2008, IDC, 1cm, Stage IB, Grade 2, 0/16 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: MRI and Vacumn biopsy carollyn carollyn

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2008 04:24PM carollyn wrote: Does anyone know of anyone to be B9 after negative mammo's, negative US's and scheduled for MRI biopsy?  Just curious as all those that have answered MRI and vacumn assist questions all have thier stats listed.  ??????? Thanks
Posts.Title: MRI and Vacumn biopsy carollyn carollyn

Posts.Content: Apr 8, 2008 04:41PM carollyn wrote: Let me further explain, the tech only did my mammo's as usual.  The physician, whom deals with nothing else but breast ultra sounds and MRI's was the one that called my one tumor malignant.  She had my history from before, paternal grandmother w/pancreatic cancer, father prostate cancer and melanoma's, me cervical cancer and polycystic ovarian disease, sister cervical cancer, me alh lumpectomy 18 months ago.  So I just thought she was comfortable spitting out what she believed to be a truthful judgement.  She understands that I am a 20 year veteran as a intelligence analyst for the government, so therefore she felt I liked things straight forward and to the point.  These are doctors from Jackson Institute of Cancer in Miami Florida that loan themselves to the VA hospital.  Because the male to female ratio is so much higher within Veterans hospitals, woman receive some of the best, time attention medical treatment.  Plus I just spoke today to a client of my business, and she had the vacumn assist MRI, and said it was worse (painwise) than her double masectomy.  I was going to drive myself, but she said no way, bring your husband.  Thanks for the help everyone, I will let you all know how things go over the next couple of days.
Posts.Title: MRI and Vacumn biopsy carollyn carollyn

Posts.Content: May 1, 2008 06:02PM carollyn wrote: Marylynn, I to have same Dx, same age, yet the BS and RAD doc's state I have node involvement (MRI reports same thing).  I have opted for a bilateral mast for the following reasons.  My age:  I am still young and in great health and can handle this surgery and therapy hands down.  My mental health:  I am not scared, and at this point am extremely positive of my outcome.  My family:  this is my second go round (dx jul 2006: ADH, lumpectomy) and I can tell you The big 'C' in my breasts has scared the bee-jeepers out of my DH and DD.  I don't want to go through this again, nor do I want them to go through this again, especially 10 or more years down the road when I'm a little older, a little more fearful, or not as strong physically.  This is what I told my BS, and he liked my answer.  You have to do what is right for you, mentally.  If you are thinking it isn't the time and are sure of your feelings, then stick with them.  Find a place within to calm yourself and satisfy your soul.  Yhere is only one right decision: yours.   Regards Carol
Posts.Title: Not sure what to do. MaryLynn Shirlann

Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2008 03:58PM carollyn wrote: Thanks for the warm fuzzy!!!  Yes I to have a new suspicious 2.4 at my old lumpectomy site on my sternum as well as the 3.9 (deep) that showed on both mammo's and US.  Hoping for the best as usual.
